actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide additional restrictions on tax-exempt bonds used to provide residential rental property for family units.

summary.text: Amends Internal Revenue Code provisions relating to bonds used by tax-exempt organizations (501(c)(3) bonds). Describes the treatment of property originally financed with taxable debt and later refinanced with tax-exempt debt. Requires residential rental projects financed with 501(c)(3) bonds to meet specified low-income criteria. Treats as arbitrage bonds certain bonds whose proceeds are used for higher yielding investments in residential rental property for family units within the issuer's jurisdiction.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide additional restrictions on tax-exempt bonds used to provide residential rental property for family units.
